summary: This is an email from a Supervisory Staff Attorney at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center to the Warden, summarizing conversations with two of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys on August 9, 2019. The discussions concerned Epstein's request for water access during attorney conferences and his housing conditions, specifically rejecting requests to house him in the Cadre unit or alone in the SHU due to his pretrial status and prior suicide attempt/gesture.

keyFacts: On August 9, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys made requests regarding his housing conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including housing in the Cadre unit or alone in the SHU.
Both housing requests were denied: the Cadre request because Epstein was a pretrial inmate, and the SHU request because of his prior suicide attempt/gesture.
The attorneys did not reference consideration for suicide watch or psychological observation during these conversations.
This correspondence documents institutional awareness of Epstein's prior suicide attempt/gesture and the resulting housing restrictions just days before his death.
The email is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY document set related to the Epstein case.
